caption: In San Salvador, above, and elsewhere in Latin America, the incarcerated population has exploded. Many prisons are run by gangs.
image_1.context: Officials in Colombia have declared an emergency in its prisons after two guards were killed and several more targeted On Feb. 14 in Brazil, two inmates with connections to a major gang became the first to escape from one of the nation’s five maximum-security federal prisons, officials said. MEXICO CITY — Ecuador’s military was sent in to seize control of the country’s prisons last month after two major gang leaders escaped and criminal groups quickly set off a nationwide revolt that paralyzed the country. This article is by Maria AbiHabib, Annie Correal and Jack Nicas. Headquarters For the Gangs? Penitentiaries. VOL. CLXXIII . . . . No. 60,072 © 2024 The New York Times Company THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 2024
image_1.description: The image depicts a scene inside a prison in San Salvador, highlighting the overcrowded and tense conditions. In the foreground, a guard wearing a light blue uniform and a black balaclava is seen opening a metal door with a perforated panel. Another guard, also in a light blue uniform, stands nearby, observing the situation. A prisoner, dressed in a white outfit and wearing a mask, is being escorted through the door. The background shows multiple prisoners standing behind bars on different levels of the prison, all dressed in white uniforms. Some prisoners are looking towards the camera, while others are engaged in various activities. The overall atmosphere is one of tension and control, reflecting the challenges faced by prisons in Latin America where many are run by gangs. The guards appear to be maintaining order, while the prisoners are confined within their cells.

caption: In a Tel Aviv square, an artist installed a 30-yard tunnel to simulate the experiences of hostages.
image_2.context: By A Tiny Isle’s Fight to Reclaim Its Domain Online Those sent to prison are often left with one choice: Join a gang or face their wrath. Latin America’s prison population has exploded over the last two decades, driven by stricter crime measures like pretrial detentions, but governments across the region have not spent enough to handle the surge and instead have often relinquished control to inmates, experts on penal systems say. “That’s where let’s say the management positions are, the command positions,” he added. “It is where they give the orders and dispensations for gangs to terrorize the country.” attacks, the plaza has continued to attract a steady stream of Israelis and tourists on volunteer missions who want to support the families. But it has also become a home away from home for the parents, adult children, siblings, cousins and other relatives of hostages. Although it can get damp and chilly in Tel Aviv in the winter, many have set up tents in the plaza, often sleeping there, keeping company with the only other people in the world who they say can truly understand what they are experiencing — the family members of other hostages. Continued on Page A6
image_2.description: The image depicts an elderly man standing inside a narrow, dimly lit tunnel. The tunnel walls are covered with graffiti and various posters. The man is wearing a black jacket over a dark shirt and gray pants. He has white hair and appears to be looking directly at the camera with a serious expression. The tunnel is approximately 30 yards long, as indicated by the context provided. The lighting is low, creating a somber atmosphere. The graffiti on the walls includes various writings and drawings in different colors. Some of the posters attached to the walls appear to be related to political or social messages, including one that reads 'Bring them home now!' The floor of the tunnel is concrete and shows signs of wear and dirt. The overall mood of the image conveys a sense of solemnity and reflection, possibly simulating the experiences of hostages as mentioned in the caption.

Both prosecutors have national profiles: Ms. Mitchell, a Republican, was tapped in 2018 to play a key role in the Senate confirmation hearings of one of Mr. Trump’s Supreme Court nominees. Mr. Bragg, a Democrat, has been a lightning rod for complaints by Mr. Trump and his supporters that he is being persecuted as he seeks another term in the White House.  proposal said Wednesday. The move would suspend longtime guarantees that give anyone who steps onto U.S. soil the right to ask for safe haven. The order would put into effect a key policy in a bipartisan bill that Republicans thwarted earlier this month, even though it had some of the most significant border security restrictions Congress has contemplated in years. The bill would have essentially shut down the border to new entrants if more than an average of 5,000 migrants per day tried to cross unlawfully in the course of a Asylum seekers and migrants in Boulevard, Calif., last week.
image_3.description: The image depicts a scene involving several individuals in what appears to be a law enforcement operation. Three uniformed officers are present, two of whom are wearing tactical gear with the words 'BORDER PATROL' and 'POLICE' visible on their backs. The officers are standing around a person who is facing away from the camera, wearing a backpack and a beanie. This individual appears to be handcuffed and is being escorted or detained by the officers. The background shows a white van with its rear doors open, suggesting that the person might be about to be placed inside. The setting appears to be outdoors, possibly near a border checkpoint or a similar location. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of authority and control, with the officers maintaining a vigilant stance.

image_4.description: The image depicts a nighttime scene of a snow-covered urban area. The main elements include a curved road that appears to be a highway or major thoroughfare, with tire tracks indicating recent vehicle activity. The road is flanked by buildings on both sides, which are illuminated by streetlights and building lights, creating a contrast between the dark sky and the lit structures. Several cars are parked along the side of the road, and there are no visible pedestrians. The buildings vary in height and design, suggesting a mix of residential and commercial properties. The overall atmosphere is quiet and serene, with the snow adding a sense of stillness to the scene. The lighting from the streetlights casts shadows and highlights the texture of the snow on the road and sidewalks.

image_6.description: The image captures a dynamic scene from a Monster Jam event. The main focus is on a monster truck, which appears to be in motion, possibly performing a stunt or racing. The truck has a distinctive white and black color scheme with red accents. It features large, rugged tires designed for off-road performance and a high ground clearance. The driver's seat is visible through the open cockpit, indicating that the driver is actively controlling the vehicle. The background shows a dirt track with tire tracks and a cone marker, suggesting a designated course for the event. The atmosphere is energetic and thrilling, typical of a live motorsport event. The audience is not visible in this particular shot, but the context implies a lively and engaged crowd.
